data.title: Panoramic background support.
data.body: https://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?p=415157#p415157

data.title: Make parameterize principled.
data.body:
- Parameterize should return a copy of the child object, if that child (or any of its children) use parameters.
- Parameterize should be supported by all nontrivial, non-stateful displayables. (Basically, anything that takes a child.)
- Parameterize should take both an argument list, and keyword arguments.

data.title: Low resolution games show jitter with linear transforms
data.body:
I briefly talked about it [here](https://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=8&t=37761#p414407), but regardless of platform or CPU speed there always seems to be a slight jitter in linear movement, applied via a transform. I can see it slightly when running games in more standard resolutions (e.g. the tutorial game) but when the game resolution is lowered it really highlights that the movement isn't smooth and scrolling can become quite eratic. Using warpers other than 'linear' masks the problem, as does using a very slow or very fast scrolling speed.

I've made a test project which shows the problem for me across all my systems (Windows, Linux, Mac, iOS), here is the download link:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/b60riwqeaosc4z0/ScrollingTest.zip?dl=1

I'm guessing that it's down to a high variance in the time between frames. Is there any debug output that would show timing per frame (other than briefly during video initialisation), and is it possible that scrolling performance could be improved by having an optional smoothing of delta time (something similar to [this](http://forum.unity3d.com/threads/time-smoothdeltatime.10253/))?

data.body: https://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=8&t=38376

data.title: Improve Progress Screen
data.body:
- [ ] Show total playtime.
- [ ] Show time + lines in current session.
- [ ] Document and make available via P?

This is the shift+alt+P screen.

data.title: Text window keep showning over developer tools while 'window auto' is using
data.body: The window auto statement keeps the say screen shown over developer tools, like variable viewer. This causes trouble to use those tools, so I think the say screen should be hidden while screens of developer tools are shown.

data.title: Gui Customization Issues
data.body:
- [x] A wider-than-normal vertical separator breaks the preference screen.
- [x] Do all buttons (incl. checkbuttons) have all button modes?
- [x] Help/About text is using the in-game text color.
- [x] Add gui.Frame, and make frame padding configurable with a global gui variable.
- [x] Perhaps a padding style mixin for buttons and such?
- [x] Introduce a 2-layer hierarchy for menu files.
- [x] Provide a way of customizing the backgrounds for non-empty frames.
- [x] Add padding and margin style properties, that set all the paddings/margins from a tuple.
- [x] Add gui.Insets, to make it possible to specify Frame insets and padding.
- [x] Maybe: somehow propagate the style prefix into a background image?

```
style foo:
    background "gui/button/{prefix}.png"
```
- [x] Confirm screen is displayed below quick buttons, but is modal. (Should hide quick buttons?)
- [x] Rename gui.SCREAMING_VARIABLE to gui.screaming_variable.
- [x] Integrate inset support into Frame, get rid of gui.Frame.
- [x] Easy two_window support.
- [x] Reduce or increase the number of colors. (probably by making choices share a color scheme with normal buttons and bars).
- [x] Add insets and images for quick buttons. 
- [x] Move file_slot backgrounds into their own directory.
- [x] Ensure config.name generates with a _(...) around it.
- [x] Create default script.rpy.

Should window auto hide the window before "call screen"?

- [x] Support default preference.whatever = 42 properly.
- [x] Add config.window_icon.

Move layout.MESSAGEes to gui.
data.body: https://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=8&t=38258&view=unread#p413571

data.title: Use proper API for determining if screen is showing in Show().
data.body: `renpy.showing()` doesn't work as the `screens` layer is not provided, and providing it gives other weird behaviour. Use `renpy.get_screen()` instead, as this works properly.

data.title: Clarify error when unable to find platform files.
data.body: This make it easier for people to figure out why their fresh git checkout won't run.

data.title: Add "selected" and "sensitive" options to buttons to manually control such.
data.body: This adds "selected" and "sensitive" properties to the screen language definition for Button, ImageButton and TextButton. When provided, they are expressions used to evaluate the selected-ness and sensitivity of the buttons instead of the provided action's `get_selected()` and `get_sensitive()`.

data.title: Some things work weirdly on windows 10 with scaling
data.body: While on other systems, from XP to 8.1, it works as intended, on 10 at first it appears without resizing and centering, closer to right bottom corner. Then, after 2-3 seconds, the game resizes and centers it.

data.title: Index Fix in UDD Doc
data.body: The upper def visit() like still looks badly indented.

data.title: Confirm action
data.body: An action, named confirm, that takes a prompt and an action, and only runs the action of the user says yes to the prompt.

data.title: add local/nested labels support
data.body:
Originally proposed here: https://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=32&t=38122

> When the script is heavy-choice, amount of labels can soon get unmanageable. I think the usual way to avoid name collisions is to use something like "chapter1_episode1_choice1", but it is ugly, verbose and still doesn't guarantee avoidance of collisions, especially when using third-party code.
> 
> To resolve this problem i propose introducing 'local' labels, which can have identical names inside different 'global' labels. Here's how it works:
> 
> ``` renpy
> label global_label:             # normal label, nothing changed for its behaviour
>   "..."
> label .a:                       # local label fully identified as global_label.a
>   "..."
>   jump .a                       # local jump, resolved to global_label.a
> 
> label another_global_label:
>   "..."
> label .a:                       # another_global_label.a
>   jump global_label.a
> ```
> 
> Syntax-wise, it's fully backwards compatible since currently label names cannot contain dot and thus all existing labels are considered global with this change.
> 
> It is also possible to expand this idea to have no nesting limit (i.e. making possible to have label a.b.c.d and jump to it inside a.b.c scope by simply "jump ...d")
> 
> I also found out that it is currently possible to 'nest' labels using indentation, but it doesn't protect from name collisions. It is possible to implement the same mechanism with such nested labels, but since it uses old syntax, it can cause problems with existing code. Also, it is more visual which can sometimes be good, but can also be bad when you prefer all statements to be on same indentation level.

While waiting for comments, i finished implementing it anyway and so making this pr for more specific discussion. If this is going to be accepted, i'll mention this in docs as well.

data.title: use config.name & config.version for build info
Document special labels.
data.body: Including "before_main_menu".

data.title: Bug with _() Translations
data.body:
I juste figured out a but with the Text displayable in combination with translations.
While generating translation files, Renpy doesn't gererate by default translation strings for the Text displayable. It is instead necessary to mark the Text with _("my string").

If I mark my displayables with _() and generate translation files, everything works fine and the translatable strings appears in the translation file. After translation I re-run the project, but there is an error message instead of the text:

'text' takes single string parameter.
So I have to remove _() from the code, then the translated text appears.

This lead to a strange workflow... first add _(), then generate translations file, translate, the remove _() from the code...

data.title: Getting more done in GitHub with ZenHub
data.body:
Hola! @TwoAvocet has created a [ZenHub](http://www.zenhub.io) account for the **renpy** organization. ZenHub is the only project management tool integrated natively in GitHub  created specifically for fast-moving, software-driven teams.

---
#### How do I use ZenHub?

To get set up with ZenHub, all you have to do is **[download the browser extension](https://www.zenhub.io?utm_source=ZHOnboarding)** and log in with your GitHub account. Once you do, youll get access to ZenHubs complete feature-set immediately.
#### What can ZenHub do?

ZenHub adds a series of enhancements directly inside the GitHub UI:
- Real-time, customizable task boards for GitHub issues;
- Multi-Repository burndown charts, estimates, and velocity tracking based on GitHub Milestones;
- Personal to-do lists and task prioritization;
- Time-saving shortcuts  like a quick repo switcher, a Move issue button, and much more.
### [Add ZenHub to GitHub](https://www.zenhub.io?utm_source=ZHOnboarding)

_Still curious? See [more ZenHub features](https://www.zenhub.io/features?utm_source=ZHOnboarding) or read [user reviews](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/zenhub-for-github/ogcgkffhplmphkaahpmffcafajaocjbd/reviews). This issue was written by your friendly ZenHub bot, posted by request from @TwoAvocet._

![ZenHub Board](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8771909/11153956/233ac4a8-89f1-11e5-94b1-1569d3f38b4d.png)

data.title: Invisible text in menus
data.body:
I've updated to the latest version, but for some reason in all the menus in the launcher, like selecting projects, themes, or languages, the text won't show up.  This will happen also in the Tutorial game, making me unable to read what the tutorial topic is.  I've tried reinstalling and refreshing, but nothing seems to make this bug go away!  Any suggestions as to what I can do?  I've attached screenshots of the bug in action.
![renpybug_languages](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/18447937/14503605/e125f3d4-017e-11e6-9202-cf0f7ffab7f9.png)
![renpybug_projects](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/18447937/14503603/e11f66b8-017e-11e6-838a-9f7251132257.png)
![renpybug_themes](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/18447937/14503602/e11e971a-017e-11e6-97b5-95e2db9ea126.png)
![renpybug_tutorialgame](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/18447937/14503604/e124aad8-017e-11e6-924c-7a9ad8c00995.png)
